Forever layoff: A rising trend turning workplaces into waiting rooms
description: Forever layoff captures a quiet shift in modern work: Layoffs that never end, only repeat. Through Dickens’s fact-driven Coketown and Kafka’s unfinished trial, this analysis traces how endless uncertainty reshapes mindspace, productivity, trust, and power at work. Jobs remain, but assurance disappears. Careers no longer progress or conclude. They linger, alert, provisional, and permanently under review.

title: How an alcoholic became Russia's biggest CIA asset
description: ​To understand Aldrich Ames, one must first strip away the mythology that usually attaches itself to traitors. He was not glamorous, not especially clever, not driven by grand visions of history. He was, above all else, familiar. A second-generation CIA man who grew up inside the culture of secrecy, hierarchy, and quiet entitlement that defined Cold War intelligence work.

Maduro and other Venezuelan politicians were followers, with Sai Baba's portrait displayed in the presidential palace.  The guru's teachings of "love all, serve all" resonated widely, even amidst accusations of misconduct.

description: A 14-year-old girl was allegedly kidnapped and gang-raped by a policeman and his friend in Kanpur. The perpetrators sexually abused her for two hours before abandoning her near her home. The family faced initial difficulties in filing a complaint due to one accused being a police officer.

title: Why there's nothing special about Trump's Greenland threat
description: America's rise to global dominance was a deliberate and aggressive process, not an overnight occurrence. Through a combination of inheritance, war, purchases, and ideological expansion, the United States systematically grew its territory and influence. This relentless pursuit of grandeur, evident from its colonial beginnings to its modern-day ambitions, forged the nation into the powerful entity it is today.

title: Scenes of frenzy: Virat Kohli gets mobbed on arrival in Vadodara - Watch
description: Virat Kohli's arrival in Vadodara for the ODI series against New Zealand sparked a frenzy, with fans overwhelming the airport. Despite the chaotic reception, Kohli, in stellar ODI form after recent centuries, heads into the series brimming with confidence. His consistent performances have made him a sought-after figure, drawing massive crowds wherever he appears.

This advisory underscores that a US visa is a privilege contingent on continuous compliance with American regulations, especially with enhanced immigration enforcement and biometric screening now in place.

T20 WC: ICC forces Bangladesh to play in India? BCB breaks silence
description: BCB president Aminul Islam Bulbul has denied reports that the ICC forced Bangladesh to play all T20 World Cup matches in India, calling them false. He said security concerns remain the board’s priority and government guidance is required. Bulbul confirmed talks with the ICC, which has shown willingness to cooperate, but Bangladesh will stay firm if safety issues persist.

The court questioned the board's transparency and sudden reversal, with a verdict expected on release day.

description: Cricket's next generation is stepping into the spotlight as legends near retirement.  Australian great Mark Waugh has tipped Indian prodigy Yashasvi Jaiswal as the future Test superstar, citing his impressive early career stats.  Meanwhile, former England captain Michael Vaughan champions England's Harry Brook for the same honour, highlighting his exciting potential. Both experts agree the game's future is bright.

The 35-year-old needs another 1,978 runs to surpass Sachin Tendulkar’s long-standing record of 15,921 Test runs, achieved across 329 innings and 200 Tests. Root has so far amassed 13,943 runs from 298 innings in 163 Tests.

While progress is evident, structural changes are crucial for Indian finance education to truly compete globally.

Why are you seeing names flashing for calls from unknown numbers?
description: India's telecom sector is rolling out Calling Name Presentation (CNAP), a new feature displaying registered caller names on incoming calls. This initiative, driven by DOT and TRAI, aims to combat rising spam and fraud by enhancing caller identification. The nationwide rollout for 4G and 5G networks is expected by March 31, 2026.

title: Google cofounder Larry Page leaves Silicon Valley: Moves assets to Delaware - here's why
description: Google cofounder Larry Page has shifted key business entities, including his family office, out of California to Delaware, Nevada, and Florida. This move precedes a potential state wealth tax, which could cost him billions. Other tech titans are also exploring exits, citing tax and privacy advantages offered by states like Delaware.

title: 'The 1am op': How demolition drive at Delhi mosque spiralled into chaos - key points
description: A demolition drive by the Municipal Corporation of Delhi near Faiz-e-Ilahi Mosque turned tense as stone-pelting injured police personnel. Authorities registered an FIR and detained individuals, with investigations ongoing using CCTV footage. The operation, ordered by the High Court to remove unauthorized constructions, proceeded with heavy machinery and security.

title: Tommy Fleetwood and Clare Fleetwood’s net worth: Golf earnings, family, fortune
description: Tommy and Clare Fleetwood have built a significant fortune through Tommy's successful golf career, prize money, and lucrative brand deals. Clare, as his manager, plays a crucial role in their financial success and their private family life. Their collaborative approach has led to both on-course achievements and long-term financial stability.

title: Travis Kelce reaches breaking point as Taylor Swift hits new career
description: As the Chiefs wrapped up a disappointing season, Travis Kelce faced mounting questions about his NFL future and the possibility of retirement. At the same time, Taylor Swift reached another career high, extending her historic run atop the Billboard 200. The contrast highlighted a pivotal moment for the high-profile couple, with one career pausing as the other surged forward.

title: Apple execs won't leave South Korea: Hunting Samsung, SK Hynix supply; iPhone RAM at risk
description: Apple executives are stationed in South Korea, seeking long-term memory chip contracts amid a severe global shortage.  RAM prices have surged dramatically, forcing tech giants like Dell, Google, and Amazon to also establish extended stays.  This "semiconductor boom" is driven by AI demand, impacting smartphone production costs and potentially leading to higher iPhone prices or reduced RAM.

title: From $13mn to $8.4b: San Francisco 49ers owner York family net worth
description: Forbes ranks San Francisco 49ers owner Denise DeBartolo York and her family at $8.4 Billion, placing them ahead of Donald Trump and Mark Cuban. The York family controls over 90% of the 49ers, now valued above $8 Billion, after decades of growth tied to NFL success and global sports investments, according to Forbes 2025 rankings released in September this year.
